page.title: 09Life in Grangetown
page.content: This morning we went down to the school library where we were talking to Mr.Norman Tough about his life in {Grangetown.}Mr.Tough is 81 years old and was born in{Grangetown}in 1904 and has lived there all his life. He told us about Grangetown when he was a boy. He told us about the cost of the {trams.}It was only \d for children and 1d for adults. When he was little if he had no money to go on the{tram he used to run along with it and then he held on to the end of the tram and he got a free ride to the town. He said he had a delivery bike with solid rubber tyres and if the tyre got into the{tram tracks}it got stuck and he had to lift it out. Then he said when he was playing outside he just left the door open and nobody ever thought of stealing anything or just walking inside the house.
